p: The primary active component of the aqueous extract of Radix Paeoniae alba is paeoniflorin (PF). This ingredient, as a monoterpene glycoside, can enhance memory and learning and has anti-oxidant and sedative properties ( 95, 96). It has been revealed that PF (0.1, 1.0, and 10 μM) reduce glutamate toxicity in PC12 cells, in a dose-dependent manner. Its protective effect was attributed to the inhibition of apoptosis via regulation of Bax/Bcl-2 signaling and MMP ( 97). In agreement with this finding, Mao et al. hypothesized that the possible protective mechanisms of PF are through anti-oxidant mechanisms and Ca 2+ antagonism in PC12 cells ( 98). Besides, pretreatment of PC12 cells with PF (100, 200, and 300 μM) inhibited the cytotoxicity of glutamate (15 mM) by increasing Bcl-2, Bcl-xL, reducing Bax and Bad expression, and preventing caspase-3/-9 activity ( 99). So, PF seems to be a potential natural compound for the treatment of neurodegenerative disorders.
